body.p:
Dixon Ky Oct 19th 1863
To his Excellency T E Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Webster County would respectfully represent to your excellency that on the 31st day of August 1863 an execution issued against N N Johnson late Sheriff of Webster County for the sum of $3348.01/100 amount of revenue due for the year 1861 with interest and the sum of $669.60 damages, & Eight & 5/100 dollars costs Upon this execution Mr Johnson has paid the sum of $3129.10/100 which you will perceive is nearly the amount of revenue due for that year, ^Oct 17th 1863^ the balance having been paid during the year 1862, ^except $873 00/100 the sheriff of Henderson county^. Now in view of the difficulties under which we know Mr Johnson laboured in the collection of the revenue for that year, we would respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the aforesaid damages or so much thereof as by law you are authorized to do

H H Smith. Master C. M. R
Wm Sammons J P W C
R. K. Thornberry
The principal interest & costs have not been paid in this case, and the damages therefore cannot be remitted

Grant Green Audr
C W Cook County Judge
M. C. Davis Circuit & County Clerk
P D Clayton Biz Lawyer
Jno A Brooks
Y. W. Brooks
S, Horrick
Pinkney Maxw
J A Jackson
Isaac Baker
Wm M Cox
W W Gentry J P
